intro: Bikkia macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf bikkia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are large, heart-shaped, and often have a velvety texture. Bikkia macrophylla typically grows in wetlands and along the edges of streams, preferring moist, sandy soils.
